alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Columbia, Lincoln, southwestern Newberry, Edgefield, Saluda and southeastern McCormick Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles north of Saluda to 10 miles east of Mccormick County Airport to near Lincolnton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Edgefield, Saluda, Johnston, Lincolnton, Ridge Spring, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Mistletoe State Park, Hamilton Branch State Park, Saluda County Airport, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Trenton, Silverstreet, Parksville, Ward, Plum Branch, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office, Scott`s Landing, Northside Fire Station Main and Knox Scout Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
